lexUnit.name: rot.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: decompose by the action of bacteria and fungi; decay or cause to decay

sentence.text: Carcasses are left to rot , while deer wounded by poor marksmen suffer lingering deaths .
Punctured skins and broken stems might admit spores and cause the fruit or vegetable to rot , often spreading to adjacent specimens .
DID the cotton wool on my apple tree twigs cause the fruit to rot ?
But many fear that the fruit will be left to rot on the trees because of cheap imported plums undercutting the market .
Later she would imagine she could smell the autumn leaves rotting on the road .
Underfoot , last year 's leaves had rotted into a soft mould which gave off a pleasant nutty scent , and small clumps of primroses nestled amongst it .
I noticed how her teeth were still white , not rotting black like those of the courtiers who constantly stuffed sweets and comfits into their mouth .
The 35 million Christmas trees bought this year would have to rot for 30 years before decomposing in dumps that are already overflowing .
In 1988 , paintings on loan from the New York Public Library were found to have mildewed and rotted in one of the society 's warehouses .
Linen and lace had rotted into cobwebs on the beds , where now there were only twisted brass bones .
Whatever decorative covering had concealed the entrance had likewise rotted into dust .
As strawberries ripen , push some straw or plastic sheeting under them so they ca n't rot on the soil .
She had dozed off in her chair : stale saliva rotted on her tongue and her cheeks prickled with unaccustomed heat .
One of the main problems of timber-framed is the tendency of oak posts to rot at the bottom .
Their frayed bodies lie rotting in drifts on the surface of the streams and are washed up in piles on the sandbanks .
Léonie saw a dropped pear rotting in the grass , bruised amber , its creamy flesh exposed , its grainy core .
His body now lay rotting under the cold grey slabs of an abbey , his strong rule was gone and , throughout the castle , nobles gathering for the council plotted and intrigued .
Avoid geraniums with double or semi-double flowers as , unlike the single varieties they do n't drop their petals as they fade , and the blooms are prone to rot in wet weather .
The hut had a muddy wooden floor , patched at the edges where the planks had rotted .
The floorboards in the centre of the room had clearly rotted , leaving gaping holes in places , and she edged her way round the perimeter , keeping the wall at her back all the time .
The structure of the wheel remains alongside the north-west elevation of the mill , although the wooden paddles have entirely rotted away and it can not be made to turn ( Plate 43 ) .
If water can penetrate and collect in joints , the wood will rot quickly unless steps are taken to prevent it .
Most of the original infections in plywood are killed in the hot pressing process , but if the material is subsequently exposed to bacteria or fungi and water it will rot quite quickly .
Our churches and cathedrals rot while we build dams and factories to worship as objects .
